cosinorage.DataHandlers module¶

module contents¶

This module provides the functionality to load Accelerometer data or minute-level ENMO data from CSV files and process this data to obtain a dataframe containing minute-level ENMO data.

classes¶

class cosinorage.DataHandlers.AccelerometerDataHandler(input_dir_path: str)[source]¶

A data handler for processing accelerometer data. This class loads, processes, and saves accelerometer data, calculating ENMO (Euclidean Norm Minus One) values at the minute level.

input_dir_path¶

Path to the directory containing input CSV files.

Type:

str

acc¶

DataFrame containing raw and processed accelerometer data.

Type:

pd.DataFrame

enmo¶

DataFrame containing ENMO values aggregated at the minute level.

Type:

pd.DataFrame

__init__(input_dir_path: str)[source]¶

Initializes the AccelerometerDataHandler with the path to the input data directory.

Parameters:

  • input_dir_path (str) – The path to the directory containing input

  • files. (CSV)

load_data()[source]¶

Loads and processes accelerometer data from CSV files in the specified directory. This method performs several transformations, including timestamp conversion, ENMO calculation, and filtering of incomplete days. It then aggregates ENMO values at the minute level and stores the result in self.enmo_df.

Processing steps include:

  1. Concatenating CSV files from the input directory.

  2. Converting timestamps to POSIX format.

  3. Calculating the ENMO metric.

  4. Filtering out incomplete days.

  5. Aggregating ENMO values at the minute level.

Returns:

None

save_data(output_file_path: str)[source]¶

Saves the processed minute-level ENMO data to a CSV file.

Parameters:

  • output_file_path (str) – The file path where the minute-level ENMO

  • saved. (data will be)

Returns:

None

class cosinorage.DataHandlers.ENMODataHandler(input_file_path: str)[source]¶

A data handler for processing ENMO data from a single CSV file. This class loads, processes, and saves ENMO (Euclidean Norm Minus One) values at the minute level.

input_file_path¶

Path to the input CSV file containing ENMO data.

Type:

str

enmo¶

DataFrame containing processed ENMO values.

Type:

pd.DataFrame

__init__(input_file_path: str)[source]¶

Initializes the ENMODataHandler with the path to the input data file.

Parameters:

  • input_file_path (str) – The path to the CSV file containing ENMO

  • data.

load_data()[source]¶

Loads and processes ENMO data from the specified CSV file. This method performs several transformations, including timestamp conversion, data renaming, and filtering of incomplete days. It then stores the processed data in self.enmo_df.

Processing steps include:

  1. Loading data from a CSV file.

  2. Selecting ‘time’ and ‘ENMO_t’ columns.

  3. Converting timestamps to POSIX format.

  4. Renaming ‘ENMO_t’ to ‘ENMO’.

  5. Dropping unnecessary columns.

  6. Filtering out incomplete days.

Returns:

None

save_data(output_file_path: str)[source]¶

Saves the processed minute-level ENMO data to a CSV file.

Parameters:

  • output_file_path (str) – The file path where the minute-level ENMO

  • saved. (data will be)

Returns:

None

class cosinorage.DataHandlers.DataHandler[source]¶

A base class for data handlers that process and store ENMO data at the minute level.

This class provides a common interface for data handlers with methods to load data, retrieve processed ENMO values, and save data. The load_data and save_data methods are intended to be overridden by subclasses.

enmo¶

A DataFrame storing minute-level ENMO values.

Type:

pd.DataFrame

__init__()[source]¶

Initializes an empty DataHandler instance with an empty DataFrame for storing minute-level ENMO values.

load_data()[source]¶

Load data into the DataHandler instance.

This method is intended to be implemented by subclasses. It should load data and store the minute-level ENMO values in self.enmo.

get_enmo_per_minute()[source]¶

Retrieve the minute-level ENMO values.

Returns:

A DataFrame containing the minute-level ENMO values.

Return type:

pd.DataFrame

save_data(output_path: str)[source]¶

Save minute-level ENMO data to a specified output path.

This method is intended to be implemented by subclasses, specifying the format and structure for saving data.

Parameters:

output_path (str) – The file path where the minute-level ENMO data will be saved.

utility functions¶

cosinorage.DataHandlers.read_acc_csvs()[source]¶

Concatenate all CSV files in a directory into a single DataFrame.

This function reads all CSV files in the specified directory that match the ‘*.sensor.csv’ pattern, concatenates them, and returns a single DataFrame containing only the ‘HEADER_TIMESTAMP’, ‘X’, ‘Y’, and ‘Z’ columns.

Parameters:

directory_path (str) – Path to the directory containing the CSV files.

Returns:

Concatenated DataFrame containing the accelerometer data from all CSV files, with columns ‘HEADER_TIMESTAMP’, ‘X’, ‘Y’, ‘Z’, sorted by ‘HEADER_TIMESTAMP’.

Return type:

pd.DataFrame

cosinorage.DataHandlers.read_enmo_csv()[source]¶
cosinorage.DataHandlers.filter_incomplete_days()[source]¶

Filter out data from incomplete days to ensure 24-hour data periods.

This function removes data from the first and last days in the DataFrame to ensure that only complete 24-hour data is retained.

Parameters:

data_all (pd.DataFrame) – DataFrame with a ‘TIMESTAMP’ column in datetime format, which is used to determine the day.

Returns:

Filtered DataFrame excluding the first and last days. If there are fewer than two unique dates in the data, an empty DataFrame is returned.

Return type:

pd.DataFrame

cosinorage.DataHandlers.calculate_enmo()[source]¶

Calculate the Euclidean Norm Minus One (ENMO) metric from accelerometer data.

Parameters:

acc_df (pd.DataFrame) – DataFrame containing accelerometer data with columns ‘X’, ‘Y’, and ‘Z’ for accelerometer readings along the three axes, and ‘TIMESTAMP’ for time information.

Returns:

DataFrame containing columns ‘TIMESTAMP’ and ‘ENMO’.

The frequency of the records is the same as for the input data.

Return type:

pd.DataFrame

cosinorage.DataHandlers.calculate_minute_level_enmo()[source]¶

Resample high-frequency ENMO data to minute-level by averaging over each minute.

Parameters:

data (pd.DataFrame) – DataFrame with ‘TIMESTAMP’ and ‘ENMO’ column containing high-frequency ENMO data.

Returns:

DataFrame containing columns ‘TIMESTAMP’ and ‘ENMO’.

The records are aggregated at the minute level.

Return type:

pd.DataFrame
